quoteText: The shepherd drives the wolf from the sheep's throat, for which the sheep thanks the shepherd as his liberator, while the wolf denounces him for the same act as the destroyer of liberty. Plainly, the sheep and the wolf are not agreed upon a definition of liberty.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: No man is good enough to govern another man without the other's consent.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Hold on with a bulldog grip, and chew and choke as much as possible.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: As I would not be a slave, so I would not be a master. This expresses my idea of democracy.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Labor is prior to, and independent of, capital. Capital is only the fruit of labor, and could never have existed if labor had not first existed. Labor is the superior of capital, and deserves much the higher consideration.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: At what point then is the approach of danger to be expected? I answer, if it ever reach us, it must spring up amongst us. It cannot come from abroad. If destruction be our lot, we must ourselves be its author and finisher. As a nation of freemen, we must live through all time, or die by suicide.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Discourage litigation. Persuade your neighbors to compromise whenever you can. As a peacemaker the lawyer has superior opportunity of being a good man. There will still be business enough.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: I like to see a man proud of the place in which he lives. I like to see a man live so that his place will be proud of him.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: We should be too big to take offense and too noble to give it.
author: Abraham Lincoln
